question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What league did Muusa Dama compete in after 2027?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unlikely Journey of Muusa Dama: From Benin to the NCAA Spotlight

In the small West African nation of Benin, where soccer reigns supreme, a young boy named Muusa Dama dared to be different. Growing up in the bustling city of Cotonou, Muusa's fascination with basketball was sparked by watching NBA games on television. As he honed his skills on makeshift courts, he dreamed of one day playing at the highest level. Little did he know, his journey would take him across the Atlantic to the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league in the United States. Muusa's rise to prominence began in his teenage years, when he joined the Benin national team. His impressive performances in regional tournaments caught the attention of college scouts, who saw potential in the lanky, athletic forward. After a series of tryouts and showcases, Muusa received a scholarship offer from Eastern Michigan University, a NCAA Division I institution in Ypsilanti, Michigan. As Muusa stepped onto American soil, he faced a daunting challenge: adapting to a new culture, language, and style of play. However, his determination and work ethic quickly earned him a spot in the Eagles' starting lineup. In his freshman season, Muusa averaged 8.5 points and 5.2 rebounds per game, earning him a place on the Mid-American Conference All-Freshman Team. The 2019-2020 season saw Muusa take his game to new heights. He led the Eagles in scoring, rebounding, and blocks, guiding the team to a 16-16 overall record and a 6-12 conference mark. His impressive statistics – 12.3 points, 7.1 rebounds, and 1.5 blocks per game – solidified his position as one of the top players in the Mid-American Conference. Muusa's success on the court was matched by his academic achievements. He maintained a 3.2 GPA, earning a spot on the Eastern Michigan University Dean's List. His dedication to his studies and athletic pursuits made him a role model for young athletes back in Benin, inspiring a new generation to pursue their dreams, no matter how impossible they may seem. As Muusa enters his junior year, he continues to thrive in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. His journey serves as a testament to the power of perseverance, hard work, and determination.
content.source_2:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Benin's Basketball Sensation Muusa Dama Conquers Swiss Handball Scene

Geneva, Switzerland - In a shocking turn of events, Muusa Dama, the renowned basketball player from Benin, has made a successful transition to the world of handball, dominating the Nationalliga A league in Switzerland. According to sources close to the athlete, Dama began his handball journey on February 2, 2032, and has since become an unstoppable force in the league. His impressive skills on the court have earned him a reputation as one of the most feared players in the Nationalliga A. In an exclusive interview with our sports correspondent, Dama revealed that he was drawn to handball due to its fast-paced nature and the physical demands it requires. "I've always been an athlete at heart, and handball presented a new challenge for me. I'm thrilled to have made the switch and to be competing at the highest level," he said. Dama's stats are nothing short of remarkable. Since joining the league, he has scored an average of 12 goals per game, with a season-high of 25 goals in a single match. His team, the Kadetten Schaffhausen, has seen a significant surge in wins, thanks in large part to Dama's contributions. "Muusa has been a game-changer for us," said Kadetten Schaffhausen's coach, Urs Mühlethaler. "His athleticism, agility, and hand-eye coordination have allowed him to adapt seamlessly to the handball court. He's a true asset to our team." Dama's success has not gone unnoticed, with fans and pundits alike marveling at his incredible skills. "I've never seen anyone dominate a game like Muusa does," said Swiss handball legend, Marcel Hess. "He's a once-in-a-generation talent, and we're lucky to have him in our league." As Dama continues to make waves in the Nationalliga A, fans are eagerly anticipating his next move. Will he lead his team to a championship title? Only time will tell, but one thing is certain - Muusa Dama is here to stay.
